title: The Exhibition in Paris – Carrefour Numérique² – March 2026
content: The Code Source exhibition will be installed at the Carrefour Numérique², at the Cité des Sciences in Paris, for the Premier Samedi du Libre XXL (PSL XXL – First Free Sarturday), starting March 7, 2026. The Carrefour Numérique² is a collaborative space dedicated to digital technology and user experience, located in the heart of the Cité des Sciences in Paris. The Premier Samedi du Libre XXL is an extended weekend version of the Premiers Samedis du Libre events, which take place every first...
creator: Camille Picard

title: Join the feed – Critical Code Studies Working Group – from Jan. 26 to 30 2026
content: A discussion thread is dedicated to the exhibition during the Critical Code Studies Working Group, starting Monday January 26 . Whether you’re a scholar, a dev, or a digital activist, join the conversation on the ethics and art of code curation. CCSWG is the major online think tank for Critical Code Studies, a hub of dialogue and collaborative inquiry that generates major thrust in the reading of code. Discussion and code critiques from previous working groups have appeared in electronic book re...
creator: Mathilde Fichen

title: Exhibition launch at UNESCO – The Software Heritage Symposium – Jan. 28 2026
content: On January 28th, the annual Software Heritage Symposium, organized at UNESCO – Paris, will mark the 10th anniversary of the Software Heritage initiative. This event recognizes software source code as a universal component of the knowledge commons and organize collective action for its long-term preservation and inclusive reuse. On this occasion, the source code exhibition will be launched at UNESCO, offering hundreds of participants an exclusive preview.   The Symposium can also be fo...
creator: Mathilde Fichen
